Text.Value: And turnips. But you are no turnip. Let that be of comfort, in your final moments.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Briefly considering, then raising his sword to strike.
EditorData.NodeContext:
<TarikS> holding sword with two hands.
Briefly considering, then raising his sword to strike. Brief break in intensity on the this whole line - delivered in almost a friendly fashion, as he believes it actually SHOULD be of comfort.

Text.Value: ...Somehow, you are making even less sense than usual.
But the stories -

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Rathgard pauses, not remembering where he placed his matches.
EditorData.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Text.Value: Stlarning shapechangers. Enough! Let us deal with these cultists - then find out where they are nesting.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Furious, begins to curse but reins herself in and refocuses.

Text.Value: Nine-Fingers set a poor trap, little banker. Let the Absolute's faithful show you how it is done.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raising voice to address Rakath / bankers. [TBD: Some cine-friendly gesture here to imply she's just killed a bunch of people. Holding up bloodied knife?]
EditorData.NodeContext: <TarikS> holding Knife with the right hand

Text.Value: Stealing your ally is one thing. Stealing your face? An ignoble act by any estimation.
Now come, Stone Lord. We have the gold - and the Absolute has need of it elsewhere.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player enters a wide chamber in utter disarray, as if recently ransacked. Unaware of the party, several fearful clerks are speaking in hushed tones around a large chest.

Text.Value: Stories. Tall tales and big names, lad - don't let them fool you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Rakath pats around his pockets looking for his matches.
EditorData.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Text.Value: The Stone Lord sees through your lies, shapeshifter. Count yourself lucky he cannot stay.
Enough play, Stone Lord. The Absolute has other plans for this one.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to strike, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

Text.Value: Step into view.
What in the howling hells...?

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting with utter shock at what she sees

Text.Value: Let Jaheira reveal herself.
As you say, Jaheira.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Beat as Minsc fights his rage - then relents and turns to Jaheira's doppel. He trots to Jaheira's side and the portal winks shut behind them, leaving us alone with cultists and clerks.

Text.Value: They have taken both Jaheira's friend and her face. Their gall knows no bounds.
Hush your fussing. Nine-Fingers had this one made especially - that little mouthful will barely slow it down.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Unconcerned, Rakath takes out a smoking pipe, and sprinkles some tobacco in.
EditorData.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Text.Value: Stealing someone's friend and their face? Boundaries clearly mean little to this lot.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The mimic falls forward, the lid straining to stay shut, Minsc emerges peeling back the rows of teeth. Standing to his full height, the beloved ranger snaps the jaws of the mimic, its tongue flapping. The creature goes limp and Minsc allows it to thump to the ground.

Text.Value: Elminster the archmage. Drizzt the drow exile. Heroes have power, aye - but not half so much as we do.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Slow zoom in on mimic as its shaking picks up pace while Rakath speaks.
EditorData.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe. (Elminster = el-MIN-ster; Drizzt = DRIZT)

Text.Value: Is that... the Beloved Ranger? Jaheira is gonna burst! I'm gonna burst. Oh my gods - Minsc!

EditorData.NodeContext: Excited, but to the player rather tahn shouted out.

Text.Value: Do nothing.
Minsc?! The same Minsc Jaheira's been looking for?
Minsc? Then the great hero is here!
Your false face does not fool my eyes. I will cut until you look like the monster you truly are.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking to the fake-Jaheira, then back at the real Jaheira, furious.

Text.Value: The Absolute has shown me your face, villain. I will beat it into a more pleasing shape.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Getting ready to attack
EditorData.NodeContext: <TarikS> Getting ready to attack with a two handed sword

Text.Value: There is no gold in here.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking down at mimic, then up at Rakath.
EditorData.NodeContext: TarikS: starting position 45 degree left, hands up stretching, turns right to look down at mimic then face forward

Text.Value: They stole her friend and her face. Damn, that's low.
Minsc? The very man Jaheira is after.
First, they took Minsc. Now, they take Jaheira's face. Does their malice have no limit?
See? Now -

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Rakath relaxes.

Text.Value: - it is those who are tricksome with the truth.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Minsc gathers the tongue up in a bear-hug and then turns, hammer-throwing the mimic across the room. 

He turns back to Rakath, breathing hard.

Text.Value: He will listen to me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Makes as if to step out, but stops short at next voice.

Text.Value: Enough play, Stone Lord.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to attack, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

Text.Value: Oh my gods. I'm gonna faint!

EditorData.NodeContext: Seeing Minsc for the first time (she's a fangirl).

Text.Value: Minsc - the very same Jaheira seeks.
First they take her friend, then they steal her face. Some people just don't understand boundaries...
If there is one thing Minsc hates more than beasts with bad breath -

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Mimic] Tongue starts moving at Minsc feets <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Minsc leans in close to Rakath's face. He stops his line, distracted.

The mimic's tongue starts moving at Minsc's feet, the monster is regaining conciousness.

Text.Value: A little coin into the right purse. A soft word in the right ear. It's not glory that spins these planes, lad - it's gold.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The mimic practically BOUNCES - then stills, and lets out a short, sharp BURP.

Rakath, satified, snaps his fingers, casting the Produce Flame cantrip, and a candle flame appears over his fingers.

He lights the pipe as he delivers his line.
EditorData.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Text.Value: Meet Minsc. He still seems very much himself to me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Preparing to step out an intervene.

Text.Value: It's still moving.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Close up of chest - revealing mimic's distinctive eyes and teeth.

Text.Value: That's the Minsc Jaheira's been searching for? Good gods...
Perhaps I can explain.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to strike, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

Text.Value: Wait, Jaheira. He doesn't seem in any state to listen.
Minsc? Jaheira's acquaintance, I believe.
Stone Lord? Better to call yourself Stone-Head.
You.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc turns to see player/Jaheira step into view.
From the vaults at the back of the room, an elf step steps into view. Jaheira, identical down to the last grey hair. She is spattered with blood.

Text.Value: Moradin's cracked clay...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Reaction shot on Rakath as he takes a step back to avoid the pool of blood flowing from the mimic toward his feet.

The pipe drops from his mouth.
EditorData.NodeContext: Moradin = MO-ra-din. Retake of line needed - breathless and fearful. You thought for sure the man you trapped was dead and done with, but he just tored his way free with his bare hands

Text.Value: First they take Jaheira's friend and then they take her face? Oh she's going to hate that.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Minsc's fat fist bursts from inside the mimic, teeth fly. Rakath squawks in alarm.
At her gesture, portions of the floor / wall shimmer with VFX. Cultists step through as if passing through water - using Meld With Stone to launch their own ambush.

Synopsis:
The player finds Rakath Glitterbeard, head banker, and his cronies gathered around a chest congratulating one another on a trap well-sprung. The chest is a mimic, which they've used to capture and kill the crime boss The Stone Lord - or so they believe.
The mimic bursts apart from the inside to reveal that the Stone Lord is none other than Minsc - and he's in the thrall of the Absolute. A doppelganger cultist is imitating his old friend Jaheira in an attempt to control him.
